comment.text: Transcription is increased specifically in response to 2,4,6-trinitrotoluene (TNT) and its indicator compounds 1,3-DNB, 2,4-DNT, and 2,6-DNT.
Has been used to construct a 2,4,6-trinitrotoluene (TNT) biosensor strain.
Belongs to the class-I pyridoxal-phosphate-dependent aminotransferase family.

property.value: P:L-phenylalanine biosynthetic process from chorismate via phenylpyruvate

feature.description: Slight increase in maximum velocity of the overall transamination reaction between aspartate and 2-oxoglutarate.
Decreases to 60% in maximum rate of the overall reactions in both directions.
Second-order rate constants are reduced by >5 orders of magnitude.
